abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Songliao Plain
            Agricultural Development Project for China was satisfactory,
            the sustainability was likely, the institutional development
            impact was substantial, the Bank performance was
            satisfactory, and the borrower performance was satisfactory.
            The lessons learned indicate that for better project
            implementation and results, the Bank should avoid projects
            with too many components and activities financed from one
            project. The woman's participation as a project in the
            Staff Appraisal Report (SAR), facilitated to achieve high
            rates of female involvement in the project. The project
            could have formulated better poverty-targeting selection
            criteria, so that the entire rural population could
            participate in all the activities sponsored under the project.
